intro: Ricinocarpus communis, commonly known as the sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to coastal regions of the Indo-Pacific and thrives in saline or brackish environments. The plant features showy yellow flowers with five petals and is often found growing on mangrove forests or salt marshes. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its stems are succulent and can store water. The plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in some cultures.
